question: Maitri bridge, which is in news recently, is build over which of the following rivers?
explanation: The Indian Army has constructed the 260 feet long cable-suspension bridge \'Maitri Bridge\' over Indus river at Choglamsar village in Leh in a record time of 40 days. It is the longest suspension bridge over the river and is built by combat engineers of the \'Sahas aur Yogyata\' regiment of the Indian Army\'s \'Fire and Fury Corps\'. The name of the bridge, \"Maitri\", is meant to symbolise the amity and solidarity between soldiers and locals. The bridge is expected to improve connectivity in remote regions of Leh and Ladakh. It will connect the remote areas of Choglamsar, Stok and Chuchot, which are said to be the largest villages in the region.
